To have escalated the rhetoric toward an obviously unstable dictator was totally irresponsible on the part of the idiot in the White House.

To see all his minions walking back his words now shows weakness on our part.

THE PORCINE'S PRESIDENCY is in total chaos.

Either the Congress or the Military needs to do something about it.

COngress needs to take care of it. if the military does it is a coup isnt it? and again, DPRK has been crazy since day one. Its self isolation just ads to its beligerance. is Trump wrong in his handling? yes.  DPRK uses its stance as proof to its people that someone else wants to kill them, and Kim is the only savior from this. So far its working..they havent had a revolution.

Another defense of a man who is starving his own people. And the "Resistance" marches on.

point that out please:)

So it begins.

China supports North Korea because it doesn't want a country with close ties to the United States on it's border.  We support South Korea because it is in our interests.

The mistake a lot of politicians make is forgetting they've been appointed but thinking they've been anointed.

Re: CAN YOU BLAME KIM JONG UN?????

318 Views

Message 24 of 44

‎08-11-2017 09:43 AM

@TxGrandpa2 wrote:
@Richva wrote:
 They are quite capable of killing the entire population of North Korea and moving in but.............for some farmland?

Perhaps you should look at a map of North Korea, possessing it would give China access to the Sea of Japan.  Farmland?  How much of North Korea is mountainous?  You looked at a topographic map of the country?  At the 42nd parallel there would be little distance from the present Chinese border to the ocean.  And it would check any ambitions Russia might further have on NK

The concern that North Koreas nuclear devices might be destroyed before China could take them?  China has been a nuclear power for decades.  If I'm not mistaken, they tested their first device back in 1967 or thereabouts.

The posts here is the only place I have ever read that China wanted N Korea. China is the overwhelming  source of the money and trade goods Kim needs to keep alive, not just in power. Kim would be delighted if the Chinese came in and developed ANYTHING.  They don't need to "buy the cow", this one has hoof & mouth and produces zero milk anyway.

@Fishslayer777 wrote: China does not want "control" politically of the Korean Peninsula. They want America out of Korea, free trading with Korea, and isolation of Japan from Asia. The Koreans and the Chinese despise the Japanese. Russia just wants chaos and destabilization... with no goal other than making money. Only China can prevent a shooting war. Ask yourself .... if North Korea launches a short range nuke against South Korea, or Japan.... does that loss of life make it "acceptable" to THEN shoot back? or is it in everyone's best interest to make sure that never happens and save lives? How long can the world tolerate the clear and present danger from the North Koreans?

Only the USA can prevent a Shooting War.......................................Trump is like Bush - He Wants a War on his Resume...........................any war - because thats what Bullies do......................they instigate & bully and then expect others to do the Heavy Lifting

There are hundreds of Thousands of Americans in harms way - not even talking Nuclear - just a conventional weapons war or even a accidental escalation will cause the deaths of many Americans For No Good Reason

The Jig is Up - it's already too late - North Korea is a Nuclear State...........................the only solution is complete annihilation of North Korea and the cost for that is too high............................

The Best Scenario now is working to prevent North Korea from Proliferating their Nuclear Capability to other State and/or Non-State Entities....................like they already did once with Syria and ISIS still has plenty of Money

China does not want a War - they are already winning the Worlds Economic Wars & the Worlds Environmental Wars - Millions of New Jobs in China in the Renewable Energy Industry - 40,000 New Jobs in America under Trump in the Coal Mining - Any Conventional or Nuclear War is Counter-intuitive to China but they are more worried about a Loose Cannon Insecure Paranoid Bully like Trump then they are Kim jong un - Kim wants to stay in power - attacking the USA in any form is going to end that forever and he knows that.......................

Trump can send Americans to Die from the Safety of Mar ERH Lago or Bedminster or the Whitehouse - and he will without blinking a eye because he has No Conscience and has No Vested Interest in this Country or it's people - evidenced multiple times when he says things like - let Obamacare Die a Slow Painful Death.....................American Citizens will be dying that Slow Painful Death and he's either to Stupid or too ambivalent to understand the distinction

( " China if You're Listening - Get Trumps Tax Returns " ) " ) " - Anonymous

Re: CAN YOU BLAME KIM JONG UN?????

330 Views

Message 26 of 44

‎08-11-2017 08:53 AM

China does not want "control" politically of the Korean Peninsula. They want America out of Korea, free trading with Korea, and isolation of Japan from Asia. The Koreans and the Chinese despise the Japanese.

Russia just wants chaos and destabilization... with no goal other than making money.

Only China can prevent a shooting war.

Ask yourself .... if North Korea launches a short range nuke against South Korea, or Japan.... does that loss of life make it "acceptable" to THEN shoot back? or is it in everyone's best interest to make sure that never happens and save lives?

How long can the world tolerate the clear and present danger from the North Koreans?

Libs are experts at Godwin's Law

@Fishslayer777 wrote: Is there anyone who doesn't believe we're gonna have a another shooting war with North Korea? If no shots are fired it's because of China. It may be the Chinese who take the first shot. My plausible guess (cloudy crystal ball) is the Chinese intervene against Kim by cutting off the money and supplies in a coordinated effort to end this. The rapid coup is support by China. Shots fired but not many. The "deal" is ......... South Korea takes over the north, all of Korea demilitarizes, Americans leave Korea, no missile defense provided "to" Japan, America supports reunification of Tiawan to mainland China, and no opposition to the island development in the south china sea. Nothing good will come out of this, as it stands today. It is untenable situation. Only China can end this drama peacefully.

I do not believe we will have another shooting war with North Korea (unless Trump wakes up grumpy one morning).  

Kim keeps increasing his nuclear capability because it is easy and keeps all the other powers at bay. China makes money off North Korea and does not want to adopt millions of uneducated, brainwashed, civilians to acquire a few million acres of farmland and a few million starving peasants. Trump is abandoning the leadership of the rest of Asia to China so what is the upside to acquiring this backward kingdom?  Better cabbage?

Re: CAN YOU BLAME KIM JONG UN?????

347 Views

Message 29 of 44

‎08-10-2017 09:44 PM

@TxGrandpa2 wrote:
@Fishslayer777 wrote: ......... South Korea takes over the north, all of Korea demilitarizes,

The scenario I've heard is that China is looking for removal of Kim, the fall of the government and they move in.  They've always wanted an outlet to the Sea of Japan.  They still have Russia to contend with.  But China is the key to all this.

I have to say that is the opposite of what I have heard. China has no interest in adopting a kingdom out of the worst of the middle ages with a population starving to the point of making tree bark soup and a level of technology barely above the horse and carriage.  Probably below that as they would eat the horse. Yes, they have 20 nukes but the worry is that they might be destroyed or launched before China could take them. Ever think of the easiest way to destroy a nuke?  They are quite capable of killing the entire population of North Korea and moving in but.............for some farmland?  Seriously? 

China is the answer but acquiring North Korea is not the question.
